update.description:
* Update magnetometer to use sdf dom.

Requires:

1. ~~https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/518/magnetometer/diff~~
2. ~~#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-sensors/pull-requests/53/mang-sensor-use-dom/diff~~

This is ready (I think). In addition to the above two pull request, which have been merged, you'll need:

1. ~~https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/523~~
2. ~~#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-sensors/pull-requests/54~~
3. ~~#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-msgs/pull-requests/113~~

content.raw:
This PR now requires:

* #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-msgs/pull-requests/117
* https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/525
content.html:
This PR now requires:

  • #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-msgs/pull-requests/117
  • https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/525

content.raw:
Thanks. What's happening now is that `components::Magnetometer` uses `sdf::Sensor`, while `components::Sensor` uses `NoData`, but the `sdf::Sesor` serialization is in the `components::Sensor` header.

How about moving the operator to a separate header that can be included by all headers that need it? I'll give it a try.
content.html:
Thanks. What's happening now is that components::Magnetometer uses sdf::Sensor, while components::Sensor uses NoData, but the sdf::Sesor serialization is in the components::Sensor header.

How about moving the operator to a separate header that can be included by all headers that need it? I'll give it a try.

content.raw: Moved: de08a0b
content.html: Moved: de08a0b

update.title: [Blueprint] Magnetometer update

content.raw: Using `sdf::Sensor` here will cause the issue that @azeey mentioned of several components trying to implement the same operator. Is there a reason not to use `sdf::Magnetometer`? We could capture `sdf::Sensor` somewhere else, like in `components::Sensor`?
content.html: Using sdf::Sensor here will cause the issue that @azeey mentioned of several components trying to implement the same operator. Is there a reason not to use sdf::Magnetometer? We could capture sdf::Sensor somewhere else, like in components::Sensor?

content.raw: Updated to use stream operators: 	dfc4447
content.html: Updated to use stream operators: dfc4447

content.raw: I'm going to make one more big change to ign-msgs with an IMU update. Maybe we can wait until that PR is in.
content.html: I'm going to make one more big change to ign-msgs with an IMU update. Maybe we can wait until that PR is in.

content.raw:
The homebrew build is failing, I think the `ign-msgs` commit has to be bumped on `homebrew-simulation`.

~~~
/Users/jenkins/workspace/ignition_gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/ign-gazebo/src/Conversions.cc:426:13: error: no type named 'MagnetometerSensor' in namespace 'ignition::msgs'
      msgs::MagnetometerSensor *sensor = out.mutable_magnetometer();
      ~~~~~~^
~~~
content.html:
The homebrew build is failing, I think the ign-msgs commit has to be bumped on homebrew-simulation.

/Users/jenkins/workspace/ignition_gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/ign-gazebo/src/Conversions.cc:426:13: error: no type named 'MagnetometerSensor' in namespace 'ignition::msgs'
      msgs::MagnetometerSensor *sensor = out.mutable_magnetometer();
      ~~~~~~^

content.raw: I'm fine getting pr #293 in. That PR looks good to me.
content.html: I'm fine getting pr #293 in. That PR looks good to me.

content.raw: pull request #293 changes the way serialization is done. We can either wait for that PR to be merged first or come back and update the magnetometer component later
content.html: pull request #293 changes the way serialization is done. We can either wait for that PR to be merged first or come back and update the magnetometer component later
